channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Asymptotic vanishing of cohomology in triangulated categories
item.description: arXiv:2405.12763v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Given a graded-commutative ring acting centrally on a triangulated category, our main result shows that if cohomology of a pair of objects of the triangulated category is finitely generated over the ring acting centrally, then the asymptotic vanishing of the cohomology is well-behaved. In particular, enough consecutive asymptotic vanishing of cohomology implies all eventual vanishing. Several key applications are also given.
item.dc:creator: Petter Andreas Bergh, David A. Jorgensen, Peder Thompson

item.title: Local index theory and the Riemann-Roch-Grothendieck theorem for complex flat vector bundles II
item.description: arXiv:2310.06616v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this paper, we prove the real part of the Riemann-Roch-Grothendieck theorem for complex flat vector bundles at the differential form level.
item.dc:creator: Man-Ho Ho

item.title: Nested homotopy models of finite metric spaces and their spectral homology
item.description: arXiv:2312.11878v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: For a real $r\geq 0,$ we consider the notion of $r$-homotopy equivalence in the category quasimetric spaces, which includes metric spaces and directed graphs. We show that for a finite quasimetric space $X$ there is a unique (up to isometry) $r$-homotopy equivalent quasimetric space of the minimal possible cardinality. It is called the $r$-minimal model of $X$. We use this to construct a decomposition of the magnitude-path spectral sequence of a digraph into a direct sum of spectral sequences with certain properties. We also construct an $r$-homotopy invariant ${\rm SH}^r_{n,I}(X)$ of a quasimetric space $X,$ called spectral homology, that generalizes many other invariants: the pages of the magnitude-path spectral sequence, including path homology, magnitude homology, blurred magnitude homology and reachability homology.
item.dc:creator: Sergei O. Ivanov
